sense.name: give pleasure, satifaction, or happiness; be pleasing to
sense.examples: I only got married to please my parents. He was always a good boy, very friendly and eager to please. It always pleases me to see a well-designed book! I am pleased to see you. We are pleased to announce our 2001-2002 Award winners.

sense.name: wish or will to do something, be the wish or will of
sense.commentary: Note: This sense does not imply a feeling of pleasure or satisfaction in the thing done.
sense.examples: She thinks she can just do as she pleases. I shall go out with whoever I please. May it please the court to admit this firearm as evidence. (If it is the will of the court...) Sit down, if you please.
